H0.text: Synthesis of enzymes is more likely to occur in a plant cell than in an animal cell.

H1.text: Formation of cellulose is more likely to occur in a plant cell than in an animal cell.

H2.text: Breakdown of glucose is more likely to occur in a plant cell than in an animal cell.

H3.text: Active transport of ions is more likely to occur in a plant cell than in an animal cell.

A4.text: Cellulose is also synthesised by tunicate animals, particularly in the tests of ascidians.

A5.text: Plant cells have cell walls composed of cellulose, hemicelluloses and pectin

A6.text: Plant cells also contain numerous enzymes, such as hydrolases, esterases, peroxidases, and transglycosylases, that cut, trim and cross-link wall polymers.

A7.text: cells walls are absent from animals and many other taxa.
